main event: On 21-22 January 1955, a bright white light with a bright red light was observed in Hutchinson, Kansas by both civilian and military personnel. The object displayed erratic behavior, rapid speed, and a hovering motion before disappearing into the distance.
interesting points: The observation was made by aircraft control tower personnel and several civilians, indicating multiple credible witnesses.
The object was described to have no exhaust or trail, and it appeared to change course rapidly before disappearing. This suggests unconventional movement.
There was no radar contact made at any time with the object, indicating a lack of traditional aircraft signatures.
US Navy Lt. Hutchinson observed a light that moved rapidly, came to an abrupt halt, and then showed a rapid downward movement at an estimated speed of over 1500 MPH.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with a slight haze, with the object observed at an elevation angle of approximately 45 degrees.
sighted object: A bright white light with a bright red light
witnesses: Aircraft control tower personnel, several civilians, and US Navy Lt. Hutchinson
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
